title: New Jersey Wildfire Burns 11,500 Acres, Could Be State's Largest In 20 Years
content: A sprawling wildfire burning in New Jersey's Pinelands near Atlantic Ocean beach towns could become the largest in the state in 20 years, having already consumed some 11,500 acres, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Oasis Fans Lose Over $2.7 Million In UK Ticket Scams
content: Oasis fans wishing to see the reunited British band live in concert have lost more than $2.7 million from UK ticket scams, mostly on Facebook, Lloyds bank said.

title: "They Killed Him": Wife Of Pahalgam Terror Victim Recalls Horror
content: Eshanaay, wife of Shubham Dwivedi, one among the 26 victims, said that they had sat down for a meal when a man appeared from behind and asked them about their religion.

title: Deserted Dal Lake, Fleeing Tourists: Clock Turns Back In Terror-Hit Kashmir
content: In less than 48 hours of the Pahalgam terror attack that left 25 tourists and a Kashmiri dead, scenes in the Valley have completely changed from what they were two days back. Flights to Srinagar are empty and those coming out of it are packed

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Victims In First Public Address After Attack
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Twenty-six people, including a Nepali national, were killed as terrorists opened fire on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district on Tuesday.

title: 5 Killers, 3 Spots, 10 Minutes Of Heavy Fire: How Pahalgam Attack Unfolded
content: A crowd of unsuspecting tourists, five to six killers, three focus spots and 10 minutes of heavy firing -- investigation into the Pahalgam terror attack, which left 26 people murdered, has thrown up the chilling events at Baisaran meadow on Tuesday

title: 121-Metre-Long Cake Gives A Taste For Records
content: French pastry chefs completed a 121.8 metre long strawberry cake which they have claimed is the world's longest ever made.

title: Huge Protest Outside Pak High Commission, Outrage Over Pahalgam Attack
content: Massive protests have erupted outside the Pakistan High Commission in the national capital amid heightened tensions between Delhi and Islamabad over the recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which resulted in the deaths of 26 people.

title: Soldier Killed In Action During Encounter With Terrorists In J&K's Udhampur
content: An Army soldier has been killed in action after security forces and terrorists exchanged fire following a search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district on Thursday, officials said.

title: US Issues "Do Not Travel" Advisory For  J&K, After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: The US has issued a 'Do Not Travel' advisory for Jammu and Kashmir owing to the "terror attacks" and possible "violent civilian unrest" in the Union Territory and also within 10 kms of the India-Pakistan border

title: "Said He Was Christian, Shot Dead": How Indore Man Was Killed In Pahalgam
content: A resident of Indore, Sushil Nathaniel, who worked as a branch manager for LIC, was killed, with his daughter Akanksha sustaining bullet injuries in the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: A Look At Elon Musk's Most Memorable Moments As Trump's Adviser
content: Elon Musk says he will step back from his controversial White House role as the unofficial head of the cost-cutting "Department of Government Efficiency" to focus more on his troubled Tesla car company.

title: A Look At Elon Musk's Most Memorable Moments As Trump's Adviser
content: Elon Musk says he will step back from his controversial White House role as the unofficial head of the cost-cutting "Department of Government Efficiency" to focus more on his troubled Tesla car company.

title: Sheikh Hasina Condemns Pahalgam Terror Attack: "It's A Grave Threat to..."
content: Bangladesh's ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has condemned the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that left 26 people dead and several others injured.

title: Palghar Man Allegedly Killing Wife Over Suspicion Of Extramarital Affair
content: Police have arrested a 55-year-old man for allegedly killing his wife in Maharashtra's Palghar district after suspecting her of having an affair with another man, officials said.

title: Intel To Cut 20% Workforce Amid Major Restructuring Efforts: Report
content: Intel has seen its sales drop three years in a row and has trailed Nvidia when it comes to advancements in technology.

title: What Is Kalima? The Sacred Islamic Verse Cited By Pahalgam Survivors
content: The meadows of Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam became the site of a horrific terror attack on April 22, in which 26 people, mostly tourists, were killed.

title: Trump's Trade War Ripples Through Business World, Hits Stocks Again
content: The ripple effects of Trump's global trade war are increasingly being felt across numerous industries all at once and on Wednesday were once again exerting pressure on U.S. stock markets that have been roiled for weeks by his erratic trade policies.

title: Warriors' Butler exits after hard fall, set for MRI
content: Warriors star Jimmy Butler suffered a pelvis contusion that forced him out of Game 2 against the Rockets on Wednesday.

title: Hall of Famer Steve 'Mongo' McMichael dies at 67
content: Hall of Fame defensive tackle Steve McMichael, who was diagnosed with ALS in 2021, died Wednesday at age 67, the NFL announced.

title: Bloodied KP fires up C's: Won't let teams 'punk us'
content: Kristaps Porzingis laughed off a bloody gash on his forehead late in the third quarter of Boston's Game 2 win, saying he knew his reaction would fire up the Celtics crowd.

title: Titans add veteran WR Lockett on eve of draft
content: The Titans are signing veteran wide receiver Tyler Lockett to a one-year, $4 million deal that could be worth up to $6 million, a source told ESPN.

title: Judge delays House settlement over roster limits
content: The judge overseeing the multibillion-dollar settlement has delayed final approval until the deal is modified to address concerns about roster limits.

title: Source: Lions make Joseph highest-paid safety
content: The Detroit Lions have agreed to a four-year, $86 million extension with All-Pro safety Kerby Joseph, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Wednesday.

title: Judge drops suit against Morant, cites self-defense
content: A judge ruled that Grizzlies star Ja Morant acted in self-defense and was immune from civil liability in the suit filed by Joshua Holloway.

title: Johnson says she's returning to LSU for last year
content: Flau'jae Johnson put to rest any doubts about her future Wednesday, telling Front Office Sports that she will be returning to LSU for her senior season.

title: Schrager's NFL mock draft: 32 predictions based on sources in the league
content: Peter Schrager's debut piece for ESPN is a Round 1 mock draft based on what he's hearing from his sources around the NFL.

title: Why Nico Iamaleava soured on Tennessee and ended up at UCLA
content: What really went down in Nico Iamaleava's split with Tennessee and move to UCLA? We go inside the drama months in the making.

title: The rapid rise of Amen and Ausar Thompson: From lottery picks to the playoffs in two seasons
content: The twins, who were drafted No. 4 and No. 5 in 2023, have been a major part of the Rockets' and Pistons' playoff berths.

content: The Titans filled their biggest need at quarterback with the No. 1 pick, but which team was next to take a QB?

content: As we approach the end of the season, it's time for big clubs to make big decisions. Let's begin with Arsenal: What should the Gunners do with their squad this offseason?

content: The way forward for Pep Guardiola will be to find multi-purpose midfielders with the quality to fill several positions.

content: These six stars -- featuring one MVP and one likely one -- need deep playoff runs to secure their places in history.

content: NFL draftees love to strut their stuff on the night they're selected. Here's a look back at some of their incredible fits.

content: The Lambeau countdown clock to the draft is running out of days, and the NFL's smallest town is ready.

content: Center Lauren Betts starts out as the front-runner to be the No. 1 pick in the 2026 WNBA draft class.

content: Ahead of a crucial semifinal tie against PSG in the Champions League, Arsenal will need several players to step it up to avoid the same mistakes.

title: Arteta: Arsenal 'dropped standards' against Palace
content: Mikel Arteta admitted Arsenal "dropped our standards" in Wednesday's 2-2 draw against Crystal Palace, which leaves Liverpool on the brink of winning the Premier League.

title: Madrid face Copa crisis as Camavinga, Alaba hurt
content: Carlo Ancelotti admitted that it will be "difficult" for David Alaba and Eduardo Camavinga to be fit for Real Madrid's Copa del Rey final clash with Barcelona on Saturday, after both picked up injuries in Wednesday's 1-0 win at Getafe.

title: Miami trades forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC
content: Inter Miami CF traded forward Robert Taylor to Austin FC for $750,000 in allocation money, the two clubs announced Monday.

title: Wrexham a 'circus,' says rival boss before clash
content: Wrexham have been described as a "circus" by Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones ahead of Saturday's showdown between the promotion-hunting League One sides.

title: Arena: Poch doesn't understand culture of USMNT
content: Former USMNT coach Bruce Arena has criticized the appointment of current head coach Mauricio Pochettino, saying that a non-American lacks the necessary understanding of the country's culture.

title: Milan dash Inter's treble dreams in Coppa semis
content: AC Milan ruined Inter's bid for a treble and advanced to the Coppa Italia final with a 3-0 derby win Wednesday courtesy of two goals from Luka Jovic.

title: Ecuadorian player's wife and child kidnapped
content: Ecuadorian soccer player Jackson Rodríguez's wife and 5-year-old child were kidnapped early Wednesday, police reported, when men broke into their home in search of the Emelec defender, who told investigators he hid under a bed.

title: Source: Rashford eyes Champions League club
content: Marcus Rashford is open to returning to Manchester United he does not believe he has the chance of first-team football while Ruben Amorim remains, a source told ESPN.

title: Ranking the top 25 men's basketball teams after the transfer portal close
content: A new team at the top. Another that climbs 12 spots. And more teams moving up or down in our latest forecast.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Time to rethink your Coors Field strategy
content: Start Colorado Rockies' bats at home and avoid visiting pitchers? That old standby strategy may be no more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Liverpool, eye Kerkez
content: Real Madrid, Liverpool and Manchester City are all looking to sign Bournemouth's Milos Kerkez. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Murshidabad violence: Five more held for rioting, total arrests now at 307
content: The arrested persons, nabbed from different places in the district on Wednesday (April 23, 2025), had direct links to the riots in which three people were killed and several injured, a senior officer said

title: Tamil Nadu’s startup growth a reflection of its potential, says Atul Anand at T.N. Startup Summit 2025
content: “One of the reasons [for the State’s success] is our multisectoral approach. It is a rich mix that will make Tamil Nadu the hub of the startup ecosystem,” said the Additional Chief Secretary, MSME Department, at the Tamil Nadu Startup Summit 2025

title: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urges Amit Shah to ensure safety of Kashmiris
content: There have been many incidents across the country wherein Kashmiri students are being harassed, beaten up, bullied and even asked to vacate their residential premises, said People's Conference president Sajad Lone

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Terrorism breathing its last; nation must believe in PM Modi's leadership, says Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath
content: Yogi Adityanath said targeting of innocent individuals based on their religious identity, especially in front of their families, is intolerable

title: Robert Vadra’s remarks on Pahalgam attack spark row; BJP accuses him of using ‘language of terrorists’
content: Robert Vadra sparks controversy by suggesting non-Muslims were targeted in Pahalgam because terrorists feel Muslims are being “mistreated”; BJP demands apology

title: U.S. issues ‘Do Not Travel’ advisory for J&K after Pahalgam terror attack
content: U.S. Department of State asks its citizens to avoid going within 10 kilometres of the India-Pakistan border “due to the potential for armed conflict”

title: What is SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme that India cancelled for Pakistan nationals after Pahalgam attack?
content: SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme provides the dignitaries of SAARC countries a Special Travel document, which exempts them from visas within the region

title: Pahalgam attack: Congress holds emergency CWC meeting
content: The meeting started with leaders paying homage to the victims of the attack by observing a moment of silence in their memory

title: Delhi High Court asks Swiggy, Zepto to reply to plea for making apps more accessible to visually impaired
content: Justice Sachin Datta issued notice to the quick commerce platforms and the Centre on the petition by NGO Mission Accessibility

title: Jain Kurian, who was trapped in Russia-Ukraine conflict zone, returns home
content: Injured Jain Kurian returns home from Russia-Ukraine conflict zone; family relieved after concerns of redeployment by Russian Army

title: Minister for crackdown on use of crude bombs to hunt wild boar in villages bordering forests in Karnataka
content: The use of crude bombs in villages bordering wildlife sanctuaries, and even territorial forests, is not new

title: Army soldier killed in encounter in J&K’s Udhampur
content: The firing took place in Dudu-Basantgarh area during a cordon and search operation which was launched based on information about the presence of terrorists, said the officials

title: Tamil Nadu bans mayonnaise made from raw eggs for one year
content: Mayonnaise is a semi-solid emulsion generally composed of egg yolk, vegetable oil, vinegar and other seasonings served along with food items such as shawarma

title: Maharashtra government arranges special flights to bring back stranded tourists from Kashmir
content: At least four flights are to land in Mumbai on April 24 to bring back Maharashtra’s tourists from Srinagar.

title: FIITJEE closure: ED conducts searches at 8 locations in Delhi NCR
content: The ED searches were on the residential premises of key alleged conspirators, including one of the promoters D.K. Goel, as well as few offices, according to agency sources

title: Jaipur family shocked at young CA’s death in Pahalgam terror attack
content: Neeraj lost his life in the gruesome attack, while Ayushi, who was at the hotel at the time, survived unharmed.

title: Bengal’s ‘untainted’ non-teaching staff in limbo as Supreme Court only offers relief to teachers
content: With families to feed and no clarity from State, non-teaching staff continue protest; eight start hunger strike

title: Bengal Congress MP writes to CM Mamata Banerjee requesting extension of force deployment in violence-hit Murshidabad
content: In the letter, he requested an extension of the duration of the camps of Central and State security forces in the specifically affected areas of Bedbona in Dhuliyan Municipality, and Jafrabad under Tinpakuria Gram Panchayat in Samsherganj.

title: Indus Water Treaty suspended: India has many options, says expert
content: India can stop sharing flood data on the rivers and it could prove detrimental to Pakistan, said India’s Indus Water Commissioner for over six years

title: Bengal’s non-teaching school staff protest job loss, demand justice
content: While the Supreme Court allowed “untainted” teachers to continue working until year-end, non-teaching staff were offered no such reprieve, leaving them feeling abandoned and betrayed.

title: Punjab put on high vigil after Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Chief Minister said that security has been beefed up in the state and strict vigil is being kept across Punjab to ensure that no one violates the law.

title: Is India witnessing judicial despotism?
content: A series of judgments in recent times has had several parties questioning the powers and motives of the Supreme Court; while such criticism of the judiciary is not new, the top court has not yet crossed the Lakshman Rekha

title: All stress and no play making children anxious, with fragile mental health
content: Psychologists and writers are linking the mental health crisis among teenagers to the rising use of digital technologies, a ‘Pandora’s box’ rewiring their brains. The way out, they say, is limiting social media use drastically for children, more unsupervised play, childhood independence and reading

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Mortal remains of the victims killed in deadly attack arrive at Bengaluru
content: The mortal remains of Manjunath Rao and Bharath Bhushan were brought back, with emotional tributes and Government support

title: Indigenously developed HPV test kits for cervical cancer screening launched in Delhi
content: Besides the high incidence of cervical cancer owing to its late diagnosis and with consequent poor survival, 25% of global mortality due to cervical cancer occurs in India, said former head of the department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology at AIIMS, Delhi

title: Pahalgam attack LIVE: Pakistan PM to chair security meeting to respond to Indus Water Treaty suspension
content: Centre to hold all-party meet at 6 p.m.; mortal remains of victims reach their families for last rites

title: Himachal Pradesh Police steps up vigil along border with Jammu and Kashmir after Pahalgam terror attack
content: A statement from the police said field units have been directed to step up surveillance and patrolling in sensitive zones, tourist destinations, bus stands, religious places, and public gatherings.

title: Forever 12th man: Why RCB fans remain loyal after 18 years and no trophy
content: In a world where loyalty often hinges on success, the RCB fan base stands out to be resilient, passionate, and endlessly optimistic. The Hindu caught up with some of its diehard fans on the eve of another match at Chinnaswamy Stadium

title: Not just DNA, proteins: CCMB team finds lipids also guide evolution
content: Scientists’ understanding of lipids is limited to their role as things that hold proteins. A study from Swasti Raychaudhuri’s lab challenges this view

title: With Hasina gone, BNP is torn by internal clashes
content: After the fall of Sheikh Hasina and the subsequent decline of Awami League, which the BNP has long seen as its most formidable rival, the party has been plagued by internal instability, with rival factions attacking each other for dominance; party leadership has warned its members against factional violence and extortion, but such warnings have had little impact on the ground

title: Elections in India have ceased to be free and fair, says A.P. former Special Chief Secretary
content: Ramesh emphasises the need for electoral reforms, saying that polls are being ‘vitiated by caste, religion, regional issues, money and inducements’

title: A.P. SSC exam topper Nehanjali scores a perfect 600, aims for IIT and Civil Services
content: She attributes her success to God’s grace, support from school and parents’ encouragement, says comprehending content instead of learning it by heart helped her

title: As society we tend to convert all civil cases into criminal: NHRC Chairperson
content: “It is due to the system, the faith of common man in criminal justice is more than administration in civil justice”

title: Scholarship for researchers from minority background face four-month delay
content: The Minority Affairs Ministry has told the students in an RTI reply that the Ministry is in the process of getting three scholarship schemes approved from the Union Government

title: Himachal decides to ban use of PET bottles in govt. meetings, hotels with effect from June 1
content: The State government has also imposed a ban on the use of certain non-biodegradable materials under the above mentioned Act to prevent pollution, save and protect the environment

title: A story of survival acquires dramatic dimensions
content: Chevittorma focusses on the resilience of families on a narrow strip of land hemmed in by the backwaters and the sea on the western fringes of Ernakulam district

title: Two decades on, proposal to widen Seaport-Airport Road still on paper
content: The State government is yet to approve a ₹40-crore proposal submitted by the Public Works department in 2022 to expand the stretch; project to decongest Collectorate Junction in the corridor also awaits nod

title: Jharkhand youth arrested for backing Pahalgam terrorists in social media post
content: The accused wrote on X in Urdu ‘Thank you Pakistan, thank you Lashkar-e-Taiba; an FIR has been lodged against the accused under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita

title: Sithalapakkam residents complain of sewage being let out on vast, open land
content: Residents irked by foul stench, say they are unable to use bore wells. Sithalapakkam panchayat president claims he has warned those who were dumping the sewage

title: Pahalgam terror attack: VHP demands action against Pakistan
content: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad and its youth wing, Bajrang Dal, announced that they would hold a nationwide protest on Friday against the terror attack

title: School-based dance routines reduce the risk of non-communicable diseases among girls, study finds
content: According to the study, a 10-minute, high-intensity dance routine during school hours reduced body fat and blood pressure in adolescent girls within 12 weeks, highlighting the effectiveness of school-based health interventions

title: Macron, Putin, Trump lead global condolences after terror strike in Pahalgam
content: Messages also came in from the travelling U.S. Vice President J.D. Vance, Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the Chief Adviser of the interim government of Bangladesh Prof. Mohammed Yunus

title: Hundreds join pony driver’s last rites, co-workers recall his attempt to stop one of the attackers in Pahalgam
content: According to local pony drivers, one of the attackers came close to the victim as Shah ‘made a bid to stop him from firing at tourists’; the victim’s father said his son was the main breadwinner for the family

title: Two-day training by EC of booth levels officers in Bihar
content: The training programme was inaugurated by Chief Election Commissioner of India Gyanesh Kumar in the presence of Election Commissioner Dr. Vivek Joshi at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Amit Shah meets victims’ families, says ‘Bharat will not bend to terror’
content: Shah, who reached Srinagar on April 22, 2025, assured the survivors of the attack that the perpetrators of the dastardly act would be brought to justice, officials said

title: Akhilesh accuses BJP of politicising Pahalgam attack
content: The SP president is believed to be hinting at a reported poster by BJP Chhattisgarh unit reading “Dharm poocha, jati nahi.....yaad rakhenge” (they asked about religion not caste, will remember)

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Hotels asked to forgo cancellation fees for J&K
content: Stakeholders in the tourism industry said that the attack would have a deep impact on domestic tourism and affect the livelihood of many in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Swiss visa rejection led newly-wed Naval officer to a nightmare honeymoon in Pahalgam
content: The couple planned to honeymoon in Switzerland, but changed plans after visa denial, says family; “Pakistan should be taught a lesson... should be ruined,” says relative

title: Chief Minister approves Mangaluru water metro project
content: Karnataka Maritime Board will prepare a detailed project report and, if implemented, it is slated to become the second-largest water transport system in India after Kochi

title: Karnataka Transport Department clarifies on panic buttons, VLTDs malfunction claims
content: This move follows a spate of complaints and viral social media videos in which cab drivers alleged that the VLTDs in their vehicles were not operational and, more critically, not linked to the department’s Command and Control Centre located in Shanthinagar.

title: India to work with Saudi Arabia to enhance stability of global oil markets
content: India and Saudi Arabia collaborate on oil markets, energy dynamics, climate change, technology, tourism, and Yemen crisis in joint statement.

title: Corporation to use reform incentive for property tax mapping and drainage work
content: Civic body chosen for reform incentive last year for its effective implementation of projects under two phases of AMRUT scheme

title: ‘We feel like we’ve been spared by divine grace,’ says Bengaluru tourist stranded in Kashmir after deadly terror attack
content: The Hindu spoke to stranded Karnataka tourists in Kashmir and the families of the victims killed in the terror attack

title: Pahalgam terror attack: The tale of two Jagdales: one killed by the terrorists, the other had miraculous escape
content: While one Santosh Jagdale visited the picturesque meadows at Jammu and Kashmir’s Pahalgam an hour before the terrorists struck at the place, the other was shot dead along with his relative

title: Government to hold all-party meet on Pahalgam attack on April 24
content: The move comes after the PM presided over a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security on April 23, upon cutting short his visit to Saudi Arabia

title: Union Health Ministry brings in new competency-based curricula for 10 allied and healthcare professions
content: India is skilling its healthcare professionals not just for India, but for the international market, says the Ministry; curricula of professions such as Physiotherapy, Optometry and Dialysis Therapy to see revision

title: Newly-wed Kanpur man among dead in Pahalgam terror attack, Yogi expresses condolences
content: Kanpur resident Shubham Dwivedi got married on Feb. 12; he, his wife, and ten others of his family were on a holiday trip to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: New AKG Centre building inaugurated
content: New AKG centre is the second building in the State to have a GRIHA-4 rating, endorsed by the Union Ministry of New and Renewable Energy

title: FKCCI calls for a quick reassessment of minimum wages to prevent closure of MSMEs
content: ‘The cost of doing business in Karnataka is now significantly higher than in neighbouring States like Tamil Nadu, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Indus treaty with Pakistan put on hold
content: India flags ‘Pakistan links’ to Pahalgam attack, unveils 5-pronged response; Attari check post shut, Pakistan nationals told to return by May 1; special visas deemed cancelled; diplomatic staff to be withdrawn

title: Karnataka government to bring back 40 stranded tourists on special flight
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah also announces ₹10 lakh compensation to the family of the victims

title: India emerging as key automobile and aviation hub: Union Minister
content: K. Rammohan Naidu says India’s aviation and auto sectors are booming, creating livelihood opportunities nationwide

title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Medha Patkar for failing to comply with court order
content: Court says she failed to comply with its order to submit probation bonds and deposit ₹1 lakh fine in a 24-year-old defamation case filed by Delhi Lieutenant Governor V.K. Saxena

title: Pahalgam terror attack: body of Keralite brought to Kochi
content: The body of N. Ramachandran was flown to Kochi airport amidst emotional scenes and sloganeering against terrorism

title: J&K attack: Name’s Bharath, said Bengaluru techie, took bullet to head
content: Bengalurean techie Bharath Bhushan was tragically killed by terrorists in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, simply for identifying himself as 'Bharath,' a name synonymous with India. The 35-year-old was shot in front of his wife and son, turning a family vacation into a nightmare.

title: Video shows man entering Pak High Commission with cake amid Pahalgam attack
content: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, claimed by TRF, leading to India downgrading diplomatic ties and suspending the Indus Water Treaty. India served a persona non grata notice to Pakistani military diplomats. Amidst this, a man carrying a cake was seen entering the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, while security measures were heightened.

title: Is China a better bet than India? Top 4 reasons
content: UBS has upgraded India's equity rating to 'Neutral' amidst a defensive shift in emerging market strategy, favoring domestic-focused economies. While acknowledging India's strengths like earnings resilience and lower oil price benefits, UBS cites concerns over lackluster corporate earnings.

title: Pahalgam attack: Government of Pakistan's Twitter account withheld
content: Following the tragic terrorist attack in Pahalgam that killed 26 tourists, India has withheld the Pakistan government's Twitter account and suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. Further measures include closing the Attari land-transit post and revoking SAARC visa exemptions for Pakistani nationals, demanding their departure within 48 hours.

title: 'I KILL YOU': Team India head coach gets death threat email
content: Gautam Gambhir, the head coach of the India men's cricket team, is under police protection after receiving threatening emails. The Delhi Police are investigating the threats, which arrived on April 22, the same day as a terrorist attack in Kashmir. The emails, purportedly from "ISIS Kashmir," contained messages like "I KILL YOU.

title: ‘Gold lasts 5 generations’: Harsh Goenka’s witty post
content: Gold prices are soaring, reaching unprecedented levels. Industry leaders like Harsh Goenka and Uday Kotak are praising Indian homemakers for their wise investment in gold. Harsh Goenka shared anecdotes highlighting gold's appreciating value compared to other assets. Uday Kotak lauded Indian housewives as smart fund managers. Global economic uncertainties and geopolitical tensions are driving the gold price surge.

title: Former Pakistan cricketer makes a massive claim about IPL
content: Junaid Khan's cryptic tweet, "Daal mai kuch kaala hai," ignited controversy surrounding the IPL after Ishan Kishan's unusual dismissal during the SRH vs. MI match. Kishan walked off without an apparent edge, despite no appeal from the bowler or wicketkeeper, and the umpire's signal fueled speculation.

title: Bill Gates $16mn gift to daughter that went against ex-wife's middle class upbringing
content: Bill Gates reportedly gifted his daughter Jennifer a $15.82 million horse farm in North Salem, Westchester, following her Stanford graduation in 2018. The estate, equipped with equestrian facilities, supports Jennifer's passion for competitive horse riding. This purchase contrasts with Melinda Gates' past statements emphasizing a modest upbringing for their children, sparking discussions about wealth and values within the family.

title: Former Pakistan pacer says he will pick IPL over PSL
content: Mohammad Amir, the former Pakistani pacer, has openly stated his preference for playing in the Indian Premier League (IPL) over the Pakistan Super League (PSL). Aiming to obtain a UK passport through his wife's citizenship, Amir hopes to open doors to the IPL.

title: Tesla rival VinFast to open plant in India by end-June
content: VinFast, Tesla's rival, is shifting its focus to Asian markets, planning assembly plants in India by June and Indonesia by October, due to challenges in the U.S. market. While VinFast expands in Asia, Tesla is hesitant about entering India due to high import duties.

title: Microsoft HR head gives employees 5 days 'deadline' to ... or leave the company
content: Microsoft is implementing a new performance strategy, offering underperforming employees a severance package of 16 weeks' pay to voluntarily leave instead of entering a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP). Employees have five days to decide, and those choosing the PIP forfeit the payout.

title: 'Man came & said he's not Muslim': Wife recalls moment navy officer was shot in Pahalgam
content: Newlyweds Lt Vinay Narwal and Himanshi's joy turned to tragedy six days after their Mussoorie wedding when Narwal was killed in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir. The couple had chosen Kashmir over Europe for their honeymoon due to visa delays. Narwal's body was returned to Karnal, draped in the Tricolour, amidst widespread grief and calls for retribution.

title: Bieber's controversial ties to Pastor Judah Smith raise concerns among friends
content: Justin Bieber's ties with pastor Judah Smith and Churchome church are causing worry. Friends like Ryan Good have distanced themselves. Bieber's Drew House board appointment of Smith raised eyebrows. Bieber has publicly separated from Drew House. His recent behavior sparks concern about his well-being. Former friends are worried about Bieber's isolation as his circles shrink.

title: IPL match today, RCB vs RR: Team prediction, head-to-head, pitch report, weather update
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru will face Rajasthan Royals in their upcoming match. RCB aims to secure their first home win. The match is scheduled at Chinnaswamy Stadium. Sanju Samson will miss the game due to injury. Riyan Parag will lead Rajasthan Royals. The weather forecast predicts a hot day with gusty winds.

title: 'Made in South Korea': How Chinese companies are allegedly 'evading' Trump tariffs
content: Chinese companies are reportedly evading steep US tariffs by fraudulently exporting goods as South Korean products, according to Nikkei Asia news. Korea Customs Service revealed falsely labeled exports reached 29.5 billion won in early 2025, with 97% destined for the US.

title: 'Pak trying same tactic as Hamas': Ex -US official on Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, a former US Pentagon official likened it to the October 7 Hamas attacks in Israel, highlighting the targeting of a specific religious group. The official urged India to retaliate against Pakistan and its ISI, similar to Israel's response to Hamas.

title: 'Undeclared emergency': Oppn targets PM Modi over Bihar visit in wake of J&K attack
content: Amidst national mourning following the Pahalgam terror attack, Prime Minister Modi's Bihar visit for development projects and an election rally has sparked criticism from Congress and RJD. They question the timing, alleging insensitivity and misuse of state resources for political gains. JDU leaders prioritize the PM's program, skipping an all-party meeting on the attack.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India responds with 5 stern actions; Pakistan on edge
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 28 lives, India has taken strong diplomatic action against Pakistan, accusing it of supporting cross-border terrorism. Measures include suspending the Indus Water Treaty, closing the Attari border crossing, and cancelling SAARC visas for Pakistani nationals. Pakistan is set to convene a National Security Committee meeting to formulate a response to India's actions.

title: BSE Sensex opens 200 points down; Nifty50 below 24,300
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in red on Thursday. While BSE Sensex went below 80,000, Nifty50 was below 24,300.

title: Colin Munro's bold claim of chucking against Pakistan spinner rocks PSL
content: Colin Munro ignited controversy in the PSL by accusing Iftikhar Ahmed of chucking during Islamabad United's successful chase against Multan Sultans. Munro's gesture prompted a heated exchange, but Islamabad United secured their fifth consecutive win, propelled by Andries Gous's unbeaten 80. Earlier, Multan Sultans posted 168 for 5, with Usman Khan scoring 61.

title: ‘IKillU’: Gautam Gambhir gets death threat from 'ISIS Kashmir'
content: Former BJP MP and current Indian cricket head coach Gautam Gambhir has reported receiving death threats from "ISIS Kashmir," prompting him to seek police protection. He filed a formal complaint requesting an FIR after receiving threatening emails. This incident follows a similar threat in 2021.

title: From boom to bust: Pahalgam turns into ghost town overnight
content: Pahalgam, once bustling, turned desolate after a terrorist attack in Baisaran meadow, leaving businesses shuttered and tourists fleeing. Locals offered support as shocked visitors sought refuge in restaurants, receiving free food and reassurance. Despite the tragedy, some tourists remained, expressing sympathy for the Kashmiri people and their commitment to safety.

title: After surviving three wars, Indus Waters Treaty finally gets the axe
content: India's decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty, a significant move against Pakistan, halts regulated water flow from western rivers, impacting Pakistan's irrigation and drinking water during peak summer. This action necessitates India increasing its water storage capacity and advancing hydro-electric projects to gain long-term water control, despite the treaty surviving multiple conflicts.

title: NEET UG 2025 exam city intimation slip released, admit card expected by May 1
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the NEET UG 2025 city intimation slip on April 23, ahead of the May 4 exam. Over 23 lakh candidates can now check their allotted exam city at neet.nta.nic.in. The official admit card will be available by May 1. The offline exam will run from 2 PM to 5 PM in 566 cities. Candidates must carry valid ID and follow guidelines strictly. Results are expected by June 14, 2025.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: When Kalma stands between life and death
content: Pahalgam witnessed a terror attack. Twenty-eight tourists lost their lives. Some survived by reciting Islamic verses or due to unforeseen circumstances. A professor from Assam University recited the kalma. A techie from Bengaluru was killed for identifying as Hindu. A family from Kerala avoided the attack due to a delayed lunch order. A honeymooning couple's trip turned tragic.

title: 'Harder to negotiate': Trump, Zelenskyy spar again as Ukraine stands firm on Crimea
content: Donald Trump criticized Volodymyr Zelenskyy for his stance on Crimea, claiming it hinders peace negotiations with Russia. Trump suggested Zelenskyy's refusal to compromise and insistence on reclaiming Crimea are inflammatory and prolong the conflict. He emphasized his commitment to ending the war to prevent further casualties, while Zelenskyy maintains Ukraine's territorial integrity will not be compromised.

title: Newlyweds fled on horseback with gunshots ringing in the air
content: Barely two months into their marriage, Komal and Mihir's idyllic Pahalgam escape turned into a nightmare when a terrorist attack struck Baisaran meadow. Amidst the chaos of gunfire and falling bodies, the couple fled on horseback, their dream vacation shattered.

title: Pak distances itself from Pahalgam terror attack, claims ‘home-grown uprising’
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif disavowed any involvement, attributing the violence to a "home-grown" uprising against India's policies. This denial contrasts sharply with India's accusations of Pakistani support for militant groups. Pakistan's foreign office expressed concern but refrained from condemning the attack as terrorism, drawing criticism for potentially endorsing the violence.

title: Sachin Tendulkar turns 52: A legacy beyond numbers
content: Sachin Tendulkar, celebrated his 52nd birthday, remains cricket's highest run-scorer with 34,357 runs across 664 international appearances. His influence extends globally, inspiring modern stars like Kohli and Smith. Tendulkar's career highlights include winning the 2011 World Cup and setting numerous records, solidifying his legacy as the "God of Cricket," despite Kohli surpassing his ODI century record.

title: ‘Jaat’ Box Office collection: Sunny Deol’s action drama earns Rs 1.09 cr
content: Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda's action film 'Jaat' faces box office challenges after a promising start. The film struggles to maintain momentum in its second week. It earns its lowest single-day collection on Day 14. 'Jaat' is also facing competition from Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2'. Despite this, 'Jaat' surpasses the lifetime collection of 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'.

title: Ishan Kishan's dismissal against MI leaves leading cricket commentator 'perplexed'
content: Ishan Kishan's bizarre dismissal in the IPL clash between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians has sparked debate. Despite replays showing no contact between bat and ball, and no appeal from MI, Kishan walked, seemingly convinced he edged it. This unusual incident occurred during an SRH batting collapse, leaving commentators like Harsha Bhogle perplexed.

title: 12 states sue Trump admin over ‘chaotic and illegal’ tariff policy
content: A coalition of twelve states has filed a lawsuit challenging President Trump's tariff policy, arguing it's an abuse of power and destabilizes the economy. The states contend Trump circumvented constitutional checks by imposing tariffs without Congressional authorization.

title: Perpetrators and conspirators behind the scenes will face strong response: Rajnath
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has assured a strong response to the Pahalgam terror attack, indicating potential military options alongside diplomatic measures against Pakistan. Following a high-level security meeting, Singh cancelled his Ladakh visit, signaling heightened tensions. He emphasized India's resolve against terrorism and warned of consequences for those responsible, both directly and indirectly, for the attack.

title: Why JeM, LeT have 'shed' Islamist identities
content: Following the abrogation of Article 370, terror groups like LeT and JeM rebranded themselves as TRF and PAFF to mask their jihadist ideology and exploit claims of freedom struggle. This tactical shift aimed to evade sanctions, woo Western human rights groups, and rally cadre amidst increased pressure from Indian security forces.

title: Quit as minister or go back to jail: SC to Balaji
content: The Supreme Court has cornered DMK leader V Senthil Balaji, recently reinstated as a minister in Tamil Nadu after securing bail in a cash-for-job scam. The court presented Balaji with a choice: relinquish his ministerial post to maintain his freedom or risk having his bail revoked due to concerns about witness tampering.

title: 133 students, including Indians, get their SEVIS records restored in US
content: The US government has reinstated the SEVIS records of 133 students, many of whom are Indian, following a court order. This allows them to continue their studies or OPT programs. While some students' visas were revoked, lawyers argue that SEVIS termination, which the government downplays, significantly impacts a student's legal status, contradicting official guidance.

title: IPL: Boult's four-fer cripples Hyderabad; Rohit leads Mumbai to victory
content: Trent Boult's devastating spell dismantled Sunrisers Hyderabad's batting lineup, while Rohit Sharma's composed innings guided Mumbai Indians to a comfortable seven-wicket victory. Boult's early strikes and Sharma's anchoring knock propelled MI back into the top four, leaving SRH struggling to stay afloat in the IPL 2025 standings. Suryakumar Yadav's explosive finish sealed the win for Mumbai.

title: Robert Vadra's attack remark stirs row, BJP terms it venomous
content: Robert Vadra ignited controversy by linking the Pahalgam terror attack to perceived mistreatment of Muslims in India, alleging they feel unsafe. He cited restrictions on religious practices and mosque surveys as examples of marginalization. The BJP strongly criticized Vadra's statement as irresponsible, divisive, and an attempt to shield terrorists, demanding an explanation from Rahul Gandhi and the Congress party.

title: Childhood friends from Pune on 1st holiday with families died together
content: Pune residents Kaustubh Gunbote and Santosh Jagdale tragically lost their lives in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam during their first family vacation together. The lifelong friends were shot in front of their families, leaving behind wives and children. Jagdale's daughter, Asawari, recounted the horrific event, stating terrorists shot her father after demanding he recite the kalma.

title: Cops 'erred', skipped SOP ahead of Vance's India visit
content: J&K Police potentially overlooked vulnerability mapping in terror-prone zones before US Vice-President J D Vance's visit, a standard procedure since the Chittisinghpora massacre. This SOP involves identifying vulnerable areas and enhancing security during high-profile visits. Security officials suggest that implementing this mapping, especially in tourist hotspots like Pahalgam, could have deterred potential attacks and ensured a swifter response.

title: Assam professor recites Islamic verse, wife wipes off sindoor to bluff terrorists
content: During a terror attack in Pahalgam, Assam University professor Debasish Bhattacharya, well-versed in Islamic scripture, recited the kalma when a gunman held him at gunpoint, saving his life. His wife quickly removed Hindu symbols to conceal their identity. The family witnessed the brutal killings of tourists before escaping through rugged terrain with the help of a local horseman.

title: 'I tried it. I'm like, dude, it doesn't work': Pitchers tell their best stories of failed new pitches
content: Detroit Tigers left-hander Tarik Skubal throws a good slider . it's not the slider he wants, according to the reigning American League Cy Young Award winner . the slider belongs to Clayton Kershaw, the future Hall of Famer .

title: NBA playoff odds: Lakers solidify top-5 championship odds after Game 2 win
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds . they have traded series-favorite status with their Game 1 and Game 2 wins .

title: Eastern Conference takeaways: Celtics cruise to 2-0 lead without Tatum
content: Detroit Pistons and Cade Cunningham are back in their series against the no. 3 seed new york Knicks . the playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals.

title: Western Conference takeaways: Butler injured in Game 2 as Rockets even series
content: no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets and no. 5 seed LA Clippers played another close thriller . the series now heads to Intuit Dome in Inglewood for the first playoff games . last set of Game 2s resumed Wednesday as the no. 2 seed Houston Rockets tied the series against the No. 7 seed Golden State Warriors .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey action . the Florida Panthers return to defend their championship, but will have to contend with regular-season powerhouses including the Winnipeg Jets , Washington Capitals and Edmonton Oilers . they have emerged as the Eastern Conference favorites thanks to a 2-0 series lead over the banged-up New Jersey Devils .

title: Nine Killed, 63 Wounded In 'Massive' Russian Missile Attack On Kyiv
content: at least nine people were killed and more than 60 wounded in a "massive" missile attack . the attack is among the deadliest attacks on the capital of the three-year war . "the search for people under the rubble is underway," the state emergency service says .

title: "Slept In Car, Trains Fully Booked": Tourists On Pahalgam Attack's Aftermath
content: sunita Jaiswal and her family were at the start point of the Baisaran meadow hike . they were discussing prices of hiring horses to carry them to the picturesque tourist point . "we just knew we had to leave from there as soon as possible," she said .
